publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-385# Mr Keith Harding: Review of Licensing Laws—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to review the terms of the Licensing Scotland Act (1976) in order that licensing contracts and practices are brought into line with modern attitudes and social outlook. Supported by: Mr Brian Monteith*
S1M-385# Review of Licensing Laws (lodged on 15 December 1999) Nick Johnston*

S1M-385# Mr Keith Harding: Review of Licensing Laws—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to review the terms of the Licensing Scotland Act (1976) in order that licensing contracts and practices are brought into line with modern attitudes and social outlook. Supported by: Mr Brian Monteith, Nick Johnston
S1M-385# Review of Licensing Laws (lodged on 15 December 1999) David McLetchie*, Mr David Davidson*
S1M-385# Review of Licensing Laws (lodged on 15 December 1999) David Mundell*

S1M-385# Mr Keith Harding: Review of Licensing Laws—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to review the terms of the Licensing Scotland Act (1976) in order that licensing contracts and practices are brought into line with modern attitudes and social outlook. Supported by: Mr Brian Monteith, Nick Johnston, David McLetchie, Mr David Davidson, David Mundell
S1M-385# Review of Licensing Laws (lodged on 15 December 1999) Ben Wallace*

S1M-385# Mr Keith Harding: Review of Licensing Laws—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to review the terms of the Licensing Scotland Act (1976) in order that licensing contracts and practices are brought into line with modern attitudes and social outlook. Supported by: Mr Brian Monteith, Nick Johnston, David McLetchie, Mr David Davidson, David Mundell, Ben Wallace
S1M-385# Review of Licensing Laws (lodged on 15 December 1999) Donald Gorrie*, Mary Scanlon*

S1M-385# Mr Keith Harding: Review of Licensing Laws—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to review the terms of the Licensing Scotland Act (1976) in order that licensing contracts and practices are brought into line with modern attitudes and social outlook. Supported by: Mr Brian Monteith, Nick Johnston, David McLetchie, Mr David Davidson, David Mundell, Ben Wallace, Donald Gorrie, Mary Scanlon

S1M-385# Mr Keith Harding: Review of Licensing Laws—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to review the terms of the Licensing Scotland Act (1976) in order that licensing contracts and practices are brought into line with modern attitudes and social outlook. Supported by: Mr Brian Monteith, Nick Johnston, David McLetchie, Mr David Davidson, David Mundell, Ben Wallace, Donald Gorrie, Mary Scanlon

S1M-385# Mr Keith Harding: Review of Licensing Laws—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to review the terms of the Licensing Scotland Act (1976) in order that licensing contracts and practices are brought into line with modern attitudes and social outlook. Supported by: Mr Brian Monteith, Nick Johnston, David McLetchie, Mr David Davidson, David Mundell, Ben Wallace, Donald Gorrie, Mary Scanlon
